intro: Oxythece rigida, commonly known as the rigid oxythece, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant has finely divided, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is typically found in woodland or streamside habitats. Oxythece rigida is noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in treating respiratory and digestive ailments.
